reviewText: Segovia is of course the most influential guitarist in the history of the instrument, a true monument and these TWO films are an excellent portrayal of this superb ARTIST. Christopher Nupen (as usual) does a superb job of giving us an intimate look at the artist fully respecting his integrity and stature. An excellent offer!
These films demonstrate the keen intelligence and outstanding talent of the maestro.  Highly recommended.
This is a wonderful look at Segovia and what he believed.  I will treasure this for a lifetime.  Jamie Palumbo  [...]
If my review should focus on specific features of the product and my experience with it:  too much speech from Segovia and speaker that I hope instead of music

Although Segovia was full of himself, he had a right to be.  Today's young guitarist are technically far superior, but he could get such a marvelous tone at times.  He is a huge historical figure with respect to the classical guitar's acceptance on the concert stage, and to that end, the video has great value.

This is a great and rare glimpse into a great man. The cinematography is excellent and reminds me a bit, in this regard, of the John William's The Seville Concert Dvd & the Pepe Romero/ Nights in The Garden Of Spain Dvd - beautiful Spanish architecture, gardens & guitar - simple & perfect. I am amazed at how well the picture quality is! This should please even the harshest critic in all regards. Anyone, fan or newbie, will enjoy and learn from this piece of history!

Note: to my knowledge, there is no difference in the content between this 2012 Dvd re-release and that of the 2005 Dvd other than the now much lower price:)
